SENT.plain: We report the case of a 4-year-old girl with progressive visual loss
Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) demonstrated a perioptic subarachnoidal space dilatation
In this case, a clear differentiation between pseudotumour cerebri and optic hydrops was not possible
Administration of acetazolamid, furosemid and corticosteroids did not show any success
Progressive loss of visual function was halted with ventriculo-peritoneal shunting
We discuss MRI findings, aetiology and course of the disease, and its literature
